pros: Benefits, warmth of making a difference through service to humanity, respect in the community, career advancement, free meals, sometimes it is laid back.
cons:
Hours: Scheduled me for two 16 hour shifts with inadequate rest in between, and then after this, had to come back in 2 hours for a staff meeting.
Stress: In the mornings, the residents at the house have to go to their day services, but are reluctant to want to go. It is a juggling act of dispensing medication, preparing breakfast, preparing lunch, dressing, hygiene and documentation. If you can't get them ready in time, people (house managers and drivers) are angry. In order to get things together, it feels borderline abuse (rushing them as they are waking up and changing diapers and putting on close even if they are saying no). The whole thing could be more relaxed (more staff, less emphasis on getting them to go to dayhab if they don't want to).
Culture: Conservative and all about the suburbs. Air fresheners, fluorescent lights, TV and lack of imagination. No outings on Sunday except church. Taking the folks to church or having an alternative service feels a waste of  for people who are developmentally handicapped to the point of not being able to wipe their own bottoms.

There is room for growth if you really want it.
The relationships you develop with the individuals is worth everything and makes it enjoyable to go to work.
cons:
The pay is below average for the job field.
Residential employees must work weekends and Holidays which may effect family life.
Residential employees might be required to work overnights, than work 2nd shift in the same week.
There can be challenges that the individuals are working through that may require SCIP-R interventions for their safety and your own, but can be stressful as physical interventions are never fun.
Depending on the individual, you may be faced with challenges such as being hit, spit on, bitten, or scratched. Remember that these are the reasons we are there! To help them to cope with whatever is causing these actions.
